## Where To Start
* [This YouTube tutorial](https://d-rug.github.io/blog/2018/Martha-Wohlfeil-building-a-website) from Martha Zillig recorded at a D-RUG meeting
* [R markdown syntax](https://bookdown.org/yihui/rmarkdown/html-document.html#table-of-contents) for an HTML document
* How I created a [footer](https://github.com/rstudio/rmarkdown/issues/1680): see the comment from cderv about rendering the [_footer.html](_footer.html) file as an 'html_fragment'
* How I started [messing around with CSS](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/22931723/changing-navbar-color-for-bootstrap-yeti-theme): see the comment by richbray89 to see how I changed the navbar color in the [style.css file](style.css)

## Other Tips
* [w3schools.com](https://www.w3schools.com/html/) is a useful way tool for coding in HTML
* For CSS code, looking at the source code of a page by using the ["inspect element"](https://www.lifewire.com/get-inspect-element-tool-for-browser-756549) feature when you right click on something in the web browser is helpful for figuring out how to customize the website.
